post.subject: Re: slide 20: Reciprocal polynomials in finding Gq
post.message: What Jitendra Kumar says is perfectly correct.  Only one clarification: although the negative real part may not affect stability, the performance may be reduced, as we have seen before.  As a result, IMC takes the negative real part also as bad.

post.subject: Re: slide 7 - delay compensation
post.message: Let me give an intutitve explanation.  Remember that we have to compare the current output of the plant with the current setpoint and use this error to drive the controller.  But what is meant by the "current" output?  Is it the output "before" you apply the control effort or the output that you get "after" you apply the control effort?  Both of them will happen "simultaneously" when there is absolutely no delay in the loop.  This situation is referred to as the algebraic loop.  When there is no algebraic loop, it will be possible to distinguish between before and after.

post.subject: Re: system delay
post.message: In discrete time systems, the delay can change only in integral numbers of the sampling period.  Naturally, the control system should be capable of handling such changes.  Robust control design techniques, such as QFT and $$H^\infty$, can possibly be used in such situations.

post.subject: Re: slide 7
post.message:
It is not correct to say that delay compensation prevents algebraic loops.  I don't think that I said that in the video.


Delay compensation is used to get better control performance.

post.subject: Re: Slide 4 - Effect of plant delay
post.message:
In order to compare the results of Astrom's book, I used their example directly.  If there is no overshoot, we cannot discuss rise time as the way we have defined, because a second order underdamped system is required for overshoot and oscillations. 

Astrom has not followed our approach.  If we define 90% of the time to reach the final value as the rise time, we can arrive at an interpretation of what Astrom has used.

post.subject: Re: slide 20: Reciprocal polynomials in finding Gq- class discussion
post.message: If the inverse of the plant model is not stable, we need to find the best approximate to use IMC. Hence the reciprocal polynomials are used. This is an optimization problem.
